questions.question: What is the correct order for the process of communication?
Which of the following is not a didactic type of communication?
questions.explanation: Workshop is an example of Socratic type of communication. Examples of didactic communication include: • Lectures • Demonstrations • Television • Radio • Magazines • Newspapers. Didactic communication is one-way communication. Knowledge is imposed and learning is authoritative. No audience participation. Does not influence human behavior. Feedback is absent. Socratic communication is two-way communication. Learning is active and democratic. The audience shares opinions, ideas, and questions. Influences human behavior. Feedback is present.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an approach to health education?
questions.explanation: Socio-environmental approach is not an approach to health education.There are four approaches to health education:Regulatory approach- external control or laws placed on people by the government. Ex: ChildMarriage Act, No smoking in public places, Helmet lawService approach- government aims at providing health services to the people at their doorsteps.Its drawback is that people will not accept a service, even if it is offered free of cost unless it isbased on their felt needs. Ex: Government provided latrines free of cost yet people did not usethem because its need was not feltHealth education approach- creates awareness of health needs and problems. Awareness leads tomotivation which includes the stages of interest, evaluation, and decision-making. It is followedby acceptance of the new idea which becomes part of his existing values, known as internalization.Ex: Adoption of ORS for diarrheaPrimary health care approach- delivery of health services with the active involvement of people.Principles of community participation and intersectoral coordination are stressed here. Itsobjective is to help individuals become self-reliant in health matters. Ex: People receive guidancefrom healthcare providers (Rogi Kalyana Samiti, Mahila Arogya Samiti).

questions.question: In which model of health education does internalization occur?
questions.explanation: 719Internalization belongs to the motivation model.There are three models of health education:•• Medical model: transfer of proven medical information into education. It does not bridge thebetween knowledge and behavior.• Motivation model: creates awareness of health needs and problems. Awareness leadsgapto motivation which includes stages of interest, evaluation, and decision-making. It is followed byacceptance of the new idea which becomes part of his existing values, known as internalization.•Social intervention model: focuses on changing the social environment which subsequentlyshapes the behavior of individual and the community.

questions.question: Flannelgraphs, exhibits, and flipcharts are used to demonstrate the effect of injudicious use of antibiotics. What is this method of group communication known as?

questions.question: Which of the following is used to obtain consensus forecasts among a large number of people?
questions.explanation: Delphi method is a systematic interactive forecasting method, which is used to obtain a consensus forecast among a large number of people. It determines the degree of agreement on a topic. This can help in setting priorities or selecting alternatives in planning. This method uses questionnaires, which are answered by experts in two or more rounds.

questions.question: What is total communication used for?
questions.explanation: The philosophy of total communication is used in the education of hearing-impaired children.It requires the incorporation of aural, oral, and manual modes of communication for effectivecommunication with and among hearing-impaired people.

questions.question: In which of the given scenarios would you use the GATHER approach?
questions.explanation: The GATHER approach is mainly used for counseling, like in contraceptive counseling, wherein a person is helped to make a decision about health. GATHER stands for: • G - Greet • A - Ask • T - Tell options or give answers, H - Help in making choices, • E - Explain everything about the decision, • R - Return for follow-up

questions.question: SPIKES protocol is for:
questions.explanation: The SPIKES protocol is for breaking bad news. Each letter represents a phase in the six-step sequence. S - setting, P - perception, I - invitation or information, K - knowledge, E - empathy, S - summarizing or strategizing. Key components of the SPIKES strategy include: demonstrating empathy, acknowledging and validating the patient's feelings, exploring the patient's understanding and acceptance of the bad news, and providing information about possible interventions.
